page.syntax: Indented_List as C = *TREE_TO_OUTLINE(C treedef[,C outline_ident[,C separator]])

argument.name: Indented_List
argument.description: Data formatted as a CR-LF delimited and indented list.

argument.name: treedef
argument.description: Data formatted for display in a tree control.

argument.name: outline_ident
argument.description: Optional. Default = "" (8 spaces). A character that separates the "branches" in the tree data.

argument.name: separator
argument.description: Optional. Default = ".". A character string that represents an indent level in the indented list.

page.description: Transform an tree string to an outline string.
page.discussion: The *TREE_TO_OUTLINE() function converts data formatted for a tree control into an indented list.
page.example: dim str as C dim outline as C str = <<%a% customer.orders.items customer.orders.salespeople customer.payment.checks Location.State %a% outline = *tree_to_outline(str,"+",".") ? outline = customer +orders ++items ++salespeople +payment ++checks Location +State
